body:
Neither PHPStan nor Psalm in their current configuration catch this issue but PHPStan level 8 would:
```
$ phpstan a src/Driver/Mysqli/Connection.php
Note: Using configuration file phpstan.neon.dist.
 1/1 [▓▓▓▓▓▓▓▓▓▓▓▓▓▓▓▓▓▓▓▓▓▓▓▓▓▓▓▓] 100%

 ------ ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
  Line   Connection.php                                                                     
 ------ ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
  61     Parameter #7 $flags of method mysqli::real_connect() expects int, int|null given.  
 ------ ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
                                                           
 [ERROR] Found 1 error

issue.title: Bump PHPStan level to 8
issue.body:
|      Q       |   A
|------------- | -----------
| Type         | improvement
| BC Break     | no

See https://github.com/doctrine/dbal/issues/4869#issuecomment-943934836.

issue.title: mysqli::real_connect() last argument is considered mandatory

repository.name: phpstan
repository.description: PHP Static Analysis Tool - discover bugs in your code without running it!

issue.body:
# Bug report

Passing `null` to the `$flags` argument of `mysqli::real_connect()` is considered an error. Starting with php 8.0, this is fine for all previous arguments. With older versions, the issue happens for all arguments.

### Code snippet that reproduces the problem

https://phpstan.org/r/c1762137-213f-418b-80b7-9388aace0e4b

### Expected output

No issues.

### Did PHPStan help you today? Did it make you happy in any way?

Not yet, but the day is not over :slightly_smiling_face:

body:
That would be since https://php.watch/versions/8.1/internal-func-non-nullable-null-deprecation (so indeed PHP 8.1, more precisely in https://github.com/php/php-src/commit/b10416a652d26577a22fe0b183b2258b20c8bb86).

I pushed a fix in https://github.com/doctrine/dbal/pull/4879, which merges up #4873 into 3.1.x

Is there maybe a patch/fix for `doctrine/dbal:^2.13.7` + PHP 8.1? Experiencing this at the very moment using a CMS (TYPO3 v11.5) which depends yet on dbal v2 (with deprecation exceptions reporting enabled)
Please open a PR against the 2.13.x branch.

issue.title: Fix PHP 8.1 deprecation on `mysqli::real_connect()` calls
issue.body:
Current issue with the 2.13.x branch is that, as soon as deprecation exceptions are enabled, the `real_connect` method inside the `MysqliConnection` driver is throwing an exception; `mysqli::real_connect(): Passing null to parameter #7 ($flags) of type int is deprecated`.

To resolve this, a `0` instead of `null` will be used.
I'm not really familiar with bits values at all, so if `0` is a bad default value feel free to adjust that - was only able to track it down at that part here. :)

|      Q       |   A
|------------- | -----------
| Type         | bug
| Fixed issues | #4869 

#### Summary

Replaced the `?? null` with `?? 0` when trying to retrieve the flags' driver-options since PHP 8.1 does no longer accept `null` for the 7th parameter `$flags` of the [`real_connect`](https://www.php.net/manual/en/mysqli.real-connect) method.

body: This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
